articles.description:

articles.author: Geoff Graham
articles.description:
We’re still in suuuuuper early days with container queries. Too early for broad browser support, but Chromium already supports it, Safari started supporting it in version 16, and Firefox is presumably not far behind.
Most early days conversations …

articles.description:

articles.author: Temani Afif
articles.description:
The wave is probably one of the most difficult shapes to make in CSS. We always try to approximate it with properties like border-radius and lots of magic numbers until we get something that feels kinda close. And that’s before …
How to Create Wavy Shapes & Patterns in CSS originally published on CSS-Tricks, which is part of the DigitalOcean family. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: How to Create Wavy Shapes & Patterns in CSS

sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine — For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Andrii Zhdan)
articles.description: In this article about conducting productive meetings, Andrii Zhdan will give you a step-by-step guide on preparing a solid meeting structure that will let you follow the original plan and reach the meeting goals, and he will also share a few tips based on his design experience.
articles.title: Effective Communication For Everyday Meetings

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Michelle Barker)
articles.description: Climate change and sustainability are increasing concerns for digital organizations, as well as individuals working in tech. In this article, we’ll explore some of the ways we can raise awareness and effect change within an organization to create a more positive environmental impact.
articles.title: Sustainable Web Development Strategies Within An Organization

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Adrian Bece)
articles.description: In this article, Adrian Bece will show how to create same-document page transitions for Single Page Apps using Shared Element Transitions API and check out its future implementation and potential for creating cross-document transitions in Multi-Page Apps.
articles.title: Delightful UI Animations With Shared Element Transitions API (Part 2)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Devansh Bansal)
articles.description: Owing to tremendous advancements in Machine Learning and other technologies, chatbots have increased in popularity in the past few years. This article will show you, step by step, how to build a chatbot that meets your business goals.
articles.title: A Roadmap For Building A Business Chatbot

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Alexander Godwin)
articles.description: Integrate two-factor authentication into your Express.js app by building an application that authenticates users using password-based authentication and OTPs powered by the Twilio Verify service.
articles.title: Node.js Authentication With Twilio Verify

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Brecht De Ruyte)
articles.description: We can use the `clamp()` method today because of the great browser support. In this article, Brecht De Ruyte explains how it can be a beautiful addition to your upcoming project or as an upgrade to a previous one.
articles.title: Easy Fluid Typography With clamp() Using Sass Functions

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Adrian Bece)
articles.description: Shared Element Transitions API is a game-changing feature that will enable us to create impressive and elaborate UI animations easily. In this article, Adrian Bece will explore its incredible potential by building four real-life examples from scratch.
articles.title: Delightful UI Animations With Shared Element Transitions API (Part 1)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: How about a little inspiration boost? Well, we might have something for you: desktop wallpapers created with love by artists and designers from across the globe. They are available in versions with and without a calendar for October and can be downloaded for free. Enjoy!
articles.title: October Vibes For Your Desktop (2022 Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Trina Moore Pervall)
articles.description: Throughout the research and design processes, our unconscious biases are the greatest risk to delivering inclusive experiences. From who we include and exclude in our research to how we plan and conduct research, it’s crucial that we understand how our unacknowledged biases can perpetuate systems of exclusion.
articles.title: Unconscious Biases That Get In The Way Of Inclusive Design

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Wix Security Team)
articles.description: In this article, Wix security experts share ten “security by design” principles that emerged from their work in keeping the Wix platform secure. If you’re a developer, these tried-and-true principles can help you build your own secure applications.
articles.title: Building Your Security Strategy (Case Study)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Onno Westra)
articles.description: The customer journey is not limited to a website alone. Simply by combining the world of website design and telephony, far better results can be obtained for your organization. And thanks to the similarities and mutual benefits, it is an easy step to take.
articles.title: Phone Numbers For Web Designers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Agustinus Theodorus)
articles.description: You don’t need a framework for everything, but if you use one, this article will help you use it in the most performant way.
articles.title: Five Data-Loading Patterns To Boost Web Performance

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: SmashingConf NYC is back! A friendly, inclusive conference for designers and front-end engineers who can’t wait to learn and be inspired. October 10–13, 2022. Get your ticket!
articles.title: Meet SmashingConf New York 🇺🇸 (Oct 10–13)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Dave Feldman)
articles.description: In this article, Dave Feldman shares his lessons learned and the experiments has done as a multidisciplinary designer-founder-CEO at an early-stage startup. Let’s take a look at what it is that makes a great design process for teams of any size.
articles.title: Lessons Learned As A Designer-Founder

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (William Juan)
articles.description: If you’re considering learning Angular, this article sums up what William Juan wished he knew when he started, including the mistakes made and lessons learned the hard way.
articles.title: Things I Wish I Had Known About Angular When I Started

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: Inline validation in web forms is useful when it works, but frustrating when it fails. Too often it leads to an endless stream of disruptive error messages or dead-ends without any chance of getting out. Let’s fix it.
articles.title: Designing Better Inline Validation UX

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Drew McLellan)
articles.description: In this episode of the Smashing Podcast, we’re talking about HTML email. Do we still have to design like we would for IE5? Vitaly talks to expert Rémi Parmentier to find out.
articles.title: Smashing Podcast Episode 53 With Rémi Parmentier: Can HTML Email Use Modern CSS?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Paul Scanlon)
articles.description: Gatsby has evolved quite dramatically in the last two years. In this article, Paul Scanlon explains what Gatsby can do today, and how he used some of the new features when upgrading his personal website from Gatsby 2 to Gatsby 4.
articles.title: What’s New In Gatsby 2022?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Andrico Karoulla)
articles.description: In today’s article, Andrico Karoulla explains how to create a cool draggable effect by listening to the drag events and writing some custom logic inside the handlers.
articles.title: Building A Retro Draggable Web Component With Lit

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Matt Athanasiou)
articles.description: How can companies change their rating and review systems to better benefit users? Matt Athanasiou shares some steps to improve the experience of reviewing literature and other products — while also building stronger connections.
articles.title: Rethinking Star Ratings For Readers

articles.author: Joel Olawanle
articles.description: When you're building advanced web pages and applications, you'll sometimes want to add the copy feature. This lets your users simply click a button or icon to copy text rather than highlighting the text and clicking a couple of buttons on the keyboard. This feature is mostly used when someone
articles.title: How to Copy Text to the Clipboard with JavaScript

articles.author: Ihechikara Vincent Abba
articles.description: You can use arrays in JavaScript to store a group of variables, often referred to as elements or items of the array. Each of these elements will have an index number assigned to them starting from zero.  By default, you can use the index of an element in an
articles.title: JavaScript Add to an Array – JS Append

articles.author: Dionysia Lemonaki
articles.description: When designing a website or an app, the finished product needs to be functional, intuitive, and aesthetically pleasing. This is where UX and UI design come in. UX and UI design are two technical terms that can often be confusing. Many people may use these two terms interchangeably, incorrectly, or
articles.title: UX vs UI – What's the Difference? Definition and Meaning

articles.author: Jalmari Ikävalko
articles.description: Hi everyone, I'm Jalmari Ikävalko, a software developer in my early 30s. In this article, I’ll share my whole journey from my first contact with code to becoming the professional developer I am today.  I'll start from my childhood when I first got interested in programming. My Introduction to
articles.title: My Developer Journey – How I Learned to Code with Dyslexia and ADHD

articles.author: Edeh Israel Chidera
articles.description: The React Context API provides a way to pass data through multiple nested levels of components without having to manually pass that data to each level.  React context is one sure way of globally managing your data in your app, and it's a good way to avoid prop drilling.
articles.title: How to Avoid Prop Drilling with the React Context API

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: When you code a similar project using different methods it helps you understand each method more. We just published a course on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube channel that will teach you how to code a flight widget in JavaScript using multiple methods. First you will learn to create the project using
articles.title: Code a project three different ways (JavaScript + REST API + Database)

articles.author: Chigozie Oduah
articles.description: Machine learning is a really interesting concept in computer programming. It involves using data to train a computer program to carry out tasks.  During the process, the program learns from data by discovering patterns. This reduces the need for programmers to hard code rules in some applications. Languages like
articles.title: How to Build a Machine Learning Model in Rust

articles.author: Eamonn Cottrell
articles.description: I needed to log in to AWS. But my main email address was rejected. Apparently I'd done this in the past and the account had been irreversibly deleted.  No reset option – just a message saying the account was permanently deleted: There are about a million ways to get
articles.title: Email Alias – How to Set Up a Professional Email for Free

articles.author: Ihechikara Vincent Abba
articles.description: Data visualization is the process of interpreting or representing data graphically. Generally, it is the graphical or visual representation of data using charts, tables, histograms, and other info-graphics.  Data plays a major role in any type of organization. Data visualization helps us understand certain trends and insights, and make
articles.title: Data Visualization Tools – 2022 Guide

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: Docker and Kubernetes are important technologies that can help you scale your applications. Docker is a platform for packaging, deploying, and running applications in containers. Kubernetes is a system for managing containerized applications across a cluster of nodes. It provides basic mechanisms for deployment, maintenance, and scaling of applications. We
articles.title: Learn Docker and Kubernetes – Free Hands-On Course
